column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Alabama?
column2: Tommy Tuberville (R), 71 years old. Facts: Former Auburn football coach who won national championship; First coach elected to Senate since 1970s; Delayed 300+ military promotions in 2023 over Pentagon abortion policy.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Alabama?
column2: Katie Britt (R), 43 years old. Facts: Youngest Republican woman ever elected to Senate; Former chief of staff to Richard Shelby; Gave Republican response to 2024 State of the Union address.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Alaska?
column2: Lisa Murkowski (R), 68 years old. Facts: Appointed by her father Governor Frank Murkowski; Only senator to win as write-in candidate (2010); Votes independently from party frequently on abortion and other issues.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Alaska?
column2: Dan Sullivan (R), 60 years old. Facts: Marine Corps Reserve colonel; Former Alaska Attorney General and Natural Resources Commissioner; Born in Ohio but Alaska resident since 1990s.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Arizona?
column2: Mark Kelly (D), 61 years old. Facts: Former NASA astronaut who flew 4 space missions; Husband of former Rep. Gabby Giffords (survived assassination attempt); US Navy combat pilot who flew 39 missions.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Arizona?
column2: Ruben Gallego (D), 45 years old. Facts: Marine Corps Iraq War veteran; Son of Colombian and Mexican immigrants raised by single mother; Harvard graduate who represented working-class Phoenix district.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Arkansas?
column2: John Boozman (R), 74 years old. Facts: Former optometrist who practiced for years; Played college football at University of Arkansas; Oldest of four children raised on family farm in Arkansas.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Arkansas?
column2: Tom Cotton (R), 48 years old. Facts: Army veteran (served in Iraq and Afghanistan); Harvard Law graduate and former clerk; Was youngest senator when first elected at age 37.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from California?
column2: Alex Padilla (D), 52 years old. Facts: First Latino senator from California; Appointed to replace Kamala Harris when she became VP; Former Los Angeles City Council member and California Secretary of State.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from California?
column2: Adam Schiff (D), 65 years old. Facts: Led Trump's first impeachment as House manager; Former federal prosecutor; Stanford and Harvard Law graduate who represented Burbank area.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Colorado?
column2: Michael Bennet (D), 61 years old. Facts: Brother of journalist James Bennet (former NY Times editor); Former Denver Public Schools superintendent; Ran for president in 2020 as moderate Democrat.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Colorado?
column2: John Hickenlooper (D), 73 years old. Facts: Former Colorado Governor (2011-2019); Founded Wynkoop Brewing Company (Denver's first brewpub); Trained as geologist and worked for oil companies.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Connecticut?
column2: Richard Blumenthal (D), 79 years old. Facts: Connecticut Attorney General for 20 years before Senate; Yale Law graduate and former clerk for Justice Blackmun; Served in Marine Corps Reserve during Vietnam era.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Connecticut?
column2: Chris Murphy (D), 52 years old. Facts: Leading gun control advocate after Sandy Hook shooting in his state; Was youngest senator when first elected at age 39; Prolific social media user who live-tweets extensively.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Delaware?
column2: Tom Carper (D), 78 years old. Facts: Former Delaware Governor and held every statewide office in Delaware; Navy veteran who flew missions in Vietnam; Oldest Democrat currently in Senate leadership.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Delaware?
column2: Chris Coons (D), 62 years old. Facts: Appointed to Joe Biden's former Senate seat; Yale Law graduate who clerked for judge; Former New Castle County Executive and chemical company executive.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Florida?
column2: Rick Scott (R), 72 years old. Facts: Former Florida Governor (served 2 terms); Built healthcare company Columbia/HCA into largest; Wealthiest senator with net worth over $300 million.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Florida?
column2: Ashley Moody (R), 49 years old. Facts: Former Florida Attorney General (2019-2025); Appointed to replace Marco Rubio who became Secretary of State; Former federal prosecutor and circuit judge.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Georgia?
column2: Jon Ossoff (D), 38 years old. Facts: Youngest senator currently serving in entire Senate; Investigative journalist who exposed ISIS war crimes; Won 2021 runoff that gave Democrats Senate control.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Georgia?
column2: Raphael Warnock (D), 56 years old. Facts: Senior pastor at Ebenezer Baptist Church (MLK's historic church); First Black senator from Georgia; Won both 2021 runoff and 2022 re-election.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Hawaii?
column2: Brian Schatz (D), 52 years old. Facts: Appointed to replace Daniel Inouye (served 50 years); Born in Michigan but raised in Hawaii from age 2; Former state House member and party chair.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Hawaii?
column2: Mazie Hirono (D), 78 years old. Facts: First Asian-American woman in Senate; Born in Japan (first senator born in Japan) and immigrated at age 7; Worked way through college as hotel maid.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Idaho?
column2: Mike Crapo (R), 74 years old. Facts: Cancer survivor (prostate cancer); Chairs powerful Senate Finance Committee; Strong conservative but occasionally moderate on some issues.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Idaho?
column2: Jim Risch (R), 82 years old. Facts: Former Idaho Governor (served briefly 2006); One of wealthiest senators from cattle ranching family; Former prosecutor and ranking member on Foreign Relations.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Illinois?
column2: Dick Durbin (D), 80 years old. Facts: Senate Democratic Whip (2nd highest Democrat); Served since 1997 plus 14 years in House before that; Chairs Senate Judiciary Committee.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Illinois?
column2: Tammy Duckworth (D), 57 years old. Facts: Combat helicopter pilot who lost both legs in Iraq War; First senator to give birth while in office (2018); Thai-American and daughter of military veteran.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Indiana?
column2: Todd Young (R), 53 years old. Facts: Marine Corps veteran and Naval Academy graduate; Former prosecutor in Orange County; Known as more moderate policy-focused Republican.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Indiana?
column2: Jim Banks (R), 45 years old. Facts: Navy Reserve officer who served in Afghanistan; Former chair of Republican Study Committee (conservative caucus); First elected to Senate in 2024 after House service.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Iowa?
column2: Chuck Grassley (R), 92 years old. Facts: Oldest senator currently serving and longest-serving Republican (since 1981); Famous for visiting all 99 Iowa counties every year; Active on Twitter with folksy posts.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Iowa?
column2: Joni Ernst (R), 55 years old. Facts: First female combat veteran in Senate; Served 23 years in Army National Guard including Iraq deployment; Domestic violence survivor and advocate.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Kansas?
column2: Jerry Moran (R), 71 years old. Facts: Former 7-term House member before Senate; Born and raised in small Kansas farming town; Moderate Republican on some issues.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Kansas?
column2: Roger Marshall (R), 64 years old. Facts: Medical doctor (OB-GYN) who delivered over 5000 babies; Army veteran; Former 2-term House member from western Kansas.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Kentucky?
column2: Mitch McConnell (R), 83 years old. Facts: Longest-serving Senate Republican leader in history (2007-2025); Survived polio as child; Married to Elaine Chao (former Transportation Secretary).

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Kentucky?
column2: Rand Paul (R), 62 years old. Facts: Ophthalmologist who founded his own clinic; Son of Ron Paul (former congressman and presidential candidate); Libertarian-leaning Republican known for filibusters.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Louisiana?
column2: Bill Cassidy (R), 67 years old. Facts: Medical doctor (gastroenterologist); Founded free healthcare clinic in Baton Rouge; One of 7 Republicans who voted to convict Trump in 2nd impeachment.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Louisiana?
column2: John Kennedy (R), 73 years old. Facts: Oxford University graduate and Rhodes Scholar; Known for colorful folksy quotes and one-liners; Former Democrat who switched to Republican Party.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Maine?
column2: Susan Collins (R), 72 years old. Facts: Most moderate Republican in Senate; Serving since 1997 (only loses to Grassley in seniority among current GOP); First woman to represent Maine in Senate.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Maine?
column2: Angus King (I), 81 years old. Facts: Independent who caucuses with Democrats; Former Maine Governor (1995-2003); Founded energy conservation company worth millions.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Maryland?
column2: Ben Cardin (D), 81 years old. Facts: Chairs Senate Foreign Relations Committee; Served 20 years in House before Senate (40 years in state legislature before that); Announced retirement effective 2025.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Maryland?
column2: Angela Alsobrooks (D), 54 years old. Facts: First Black senator from Maryland; Former Prince George's County Executive; Former prosecutor who created innovative crime prevention programs.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Massachusetts?
column2: Elizabeth Warren (D), 76 years old. Facts: Harvard Law professor specializing in bankruptcy; Created Consumer Financial Protection Bureau under Obama; Ran for president in 2020 with detailed policy plans.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Massachusetts?
column2: Ed Markey (D), 79 years old. Facts: Co-author of Green New Deal with AOC; Served 37 years in House before moving to Senate; Progressive champion on climate and telecommunications issues.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Michigan?
column2: Debbie Stabenow (D), 75 years old. Facts: First woman to chair Senate Agriculture Committee; Former social worker before politics; Serving since 2001 and announced retirement effective 2025.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Michigan?
column2: Elissa Slotkin (D), 49 years old. Facts: Former CIA analyst who did 3 tours in Iraq; Worked in both Bush and Obama administrations; Represented swing district in House before Senate.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Minnesota?
column2: Amy Klobuchar (D), 65 years old. Facts: Ran for president in 2020 as moderate; Former Hennepin County Attorney (prosecutor); Daughter of journalist Jim Klobuchar (newspaper columnist).

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Minnesota?
column2: Tina Smith (D), 67 years old. Facts: Former Minnesota Lieutenant Governor appointed to replace Al Franken; Marketing executive and political strategist before elected office; Low-key policy-focused approach.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Mississippi?
column2: Roger Wicker (R), 74 years old. Facts: Former 13-term House member before Senate; Air Force veteran; Chairs Senate Armed Services Committee (defense focus).

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Mississippi?
column2: Cindy Hyde-Smith (R), 66 years old. Facts: First woman elected to Congress from Mississippi; Former Agriculture Commissioner; Appointed to Thad Cochran's seat then won election.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Missouri?
column2: Josh Hawley (R), 45 years old. Facts: Yale and Stanford Law graduate; Former Missouri Attorney General at age 37; Controversial for Jan 6 objections and fist pump to crowd.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Missouri?
column2: Eric Schmitt (R), 50 years old. Facts: Former Missouri Attorney General who sued federal government frequently; Former state senator and state treasurer; Defeated Eric Greitens in 2022 primary.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Montana?
column2: Jon Tester (D), 69 years old. Facts: Third-generation farmer who still actively farms; Only senator with flat-top haircut; Lost three fingers in meat grinder accident as child.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Montana?
column2: Tim Sheehy (R), 39 years old. Facts: Former Navy SEAL veteran (one of youngest senators); Founded aerial firefighting company Bridger Aerospace; Defeated Tester in 2024 after competitive race.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Nebraska?
column2: Deb Fischer (R), 74 years old. Facts: Rancher from Valentine Nebraska; Served in Nebraska legislature before Senate; Moderate Republican who occasionally breaks with party.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Nebraska?
column2: Pete Ricketts (R), 60 years old. Facts: Former Nebraska Governor (2015-2023); Son of Joe Ricketts (TD Ameritrade founder); Appointed to Ben Sasse's seat who left for university presidency.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Nevada?
column2: Catherine Cortez Masto (D), 61 years old. Facts: First Latina senator in US history; Former Nevada Attorney General; Granddaughter of Mexican immigrant who was Reno mechanic.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Nevada?
column2: Jacky Rosen (D), 68 years old. Facts: Former computer programmer and software developer; Synagogue president before politics; Only served one House term before winning Senate seat.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from New Hampshire?
column2: Jeanne Shaheen (D), 78 years old. Facts: Former New Hampshire Governor (first woman governor); First woman to be both governor and senator from same state; Former high school teacher.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from New Hampshire?
column2: Maggie Hassan (D), 67 years old. Facts: Former New Hampshire Governor; Mother of son with cerebral palsy (advocates for disability rights); Won 2016 Senate race by only 1017 votes.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from New Jersey?
column2: Cory Booker (D), 56 years old. Facts: Former Newark Mayor (lived in projects); Rhodes Scholar and Stanford/Yale Law graduate; Ran for president in 2020 with social justice focus.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from New Jersey?
column2: Andy Kim (D), 42 years old. Facts: Korean-American (son of immigrants from South Korea); Former Obama administration official on national security; Famous for cleaning Capitol debris after Jan 6 riot.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from New Mexico?
column2: Martin Heinrich (D), 53 years old. Facts: Mechanical engineer by training; Former Albuquerque City Council member and House member; Strong focus on renewable energy and technology policy.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from New Mexico?
column2: Ben Ray Luján (D), 52 years old. Facts: Hispanic with deep political roots (father was NM House speaker); Had stroke in 2022 but made full recovery; Former House member and DCCC chair.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from New York?
column2: Chuck Schumer (D), 75 years old. Facts: Senate Majority Leader (or Minority Leader depending on control); Serving in Congress since 1981 (House then Senate since 1999); Brooklyn native and Harvard graduate.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from New York?
column2: Kirsten Gillibrand (D), 59 years old. Facts: Appointed to Hillary Clinton's seat in 2009; Leading advocate against military sexual assault; Ran for president in 2020 with women's rights focus.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from North Carolina?
column2: Thom Tillis (R), 65 years old. Facts: Former North Carolina House Speaker; Narrowly won both 2014 and 2020 elections; Management consultant and IBM partner before politics.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from North Carolina?
column2: Ted Budd (R), 53 years old. Facts: Gun range and gun shop owner; Former 3-term House member; MBA from Wake Forest and runs investment firm.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from North Dakota?
column2: John Hoeven (R), 68 years old. Facts: Former North Dakota Governor (served 10 years 2000-2010); Banker before politics at family bank; One of wealthiest senators from oil/agriculture wealth.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from North Dakota?
column2: Kevin Cramer (R), 64 years old. Facts: Former 2-term House member and state tourism director; Strong Trump ally; Defeated Heidi Heitkamp in 2018 race.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Ohio?
column2: Sherrod Brown (D), 73 years old. Facts: Only Democrat to win statewide in Ohio recently; Populist liberal on economic issues; Former House member for 14 years and Ohio Secretary of State.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Ohio?
column2: Bernie Moreno (R), 57 years old. Facts: Colombian immigrant who became car dealership magnate; Appointed to replace JD Vance (became VP); Blockchain and cryptocurrency entrepreneur.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Oklahoma?
column2: James Lankford (R), 57 years old. Facts: Former youth camp director and ministry leader; Strong social conservative; Took office after Tom Coburn resigned mid-term.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Oklahoma?
column2: Markwayne Mullin (R), 47 years old. Facts: Former 5-term House member; Cherokee Nation citizen; Plumbing company owner who took over family business.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Oregon?
column2: Ron Wyden (D), 76 years old. Facts: Chairs Senate Finance Committee; Serving since 1996 after special election; Strong advocate for internet freedom and privacy.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Oregon?
column2: Jeff Merkley (D), 68 years old. Facts: Former Oregon House Speaker; Led 2011 filibuster reform efforts; Strong progressive voice on environmental and labor issues.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Pennsylvania?
column2: Bob Casey Jr. (D), 65 years old. Facts: Son of former Pennsylvania Governor Bob Casey Sr.; Pro-labor moderate Democrat; Serving since 2007 but lost 2024 reelection to Dave McCormick.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Pennsylvania?
column2: Dave McCormick (R), 59 years old. Facts: Former hedge fund CEO (Bridgewater Associates); Army veteran and Gulf War paratrooper; West Point graduate who defeated Casey in 2024.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Rhode Island?
column2: Jack Reed (D), 75 years old. Facts: West Point graduate and Army veteran; Chairs Senate Armed Services Committee; Harvard Kennedy School graduate with military focus.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Rhode Island?
column2: Sheldon Whitehouse (D), 69 years old. Facts: Former Rhode Island Attorney General and US Attorney; Grandson of diplomat; Strong climate change activist who gives weekly Senate floor speeches.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from South Carolina?
column2: Lindsey Graham (R), 70 years old. Facts: Chairs Senate Judiciary Committee; Air Force veteran and JAG officer; Close friend of John McCain and evolved on Trump.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from South Carolina?
column2: Tim Scott (R), 60 years old. Facts: First Black Republican senator from the South since Reconstruction; Former House member; Gave Republican response to Biden speech.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from South Dakota?
column2: John Thune (R), 64 years old. Facts: Senate Majority Leader (Republican); Former House member who defeated Tom Daschle in 2004; Second-highest Republican leader.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from South Dakota?
column2: Mike Rounds (R), 71 years old. Facts: Former South Dakota Governor (served 2 terms); Insurance and real estate businessman; Moderate conservative who occasionally breaks with party.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Tennessee?
column2: Marsha Blackburn (R), 73 years old. Facts: Former 8-term House member; First woman senator from Tennessee; Strong social conservative who defeated Phil Bredesen.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Tennessee?
column2: Bill Hagerty (R), 65 years old. Facts: Former US Ambassador to Japan under Trump; Private equity executive and businessman; Defeated Manny Sethi in 2020 primary.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Texas?
column2: John Cornyn (R), 73 years old. Facts: Former Senate Majority Whip; Former Texas Attorney General and state Supreme Court justice; Second longest-serving Texas senator after Hutchison.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Texas?
column2: Ted Cruz (R), 54 years old. Facts: Harvard Law graduate and former Supreme Court clerk; Led 2013 government shutdown over Obamacare; Ran for president in 2016 and came in second.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Utah?
column2: Mike Lee (R), 54 years old. Facts: Former Supreme Court clerk and constitutional lawyer; Tea Party conservative; Brother of former Solicitor General Tom Lee.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Utah?
column2: Mitt Romney (R), 78 years old. Facts: Former Massachusetts Governor and 2012 presidential nominee; Only senator to vote to convict president of own party (Trump); Former Bain Capital CEO and Olympics organizer.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Vermont?
column2: Bernie Sanders (I), 83 years old. Facts: Independent who caucuses with Democrats; Self-described democratic socialist; Ran for president in 2016 and 2020 energizing progressive movement.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Vermont?
column2: Peter Welch (D), 78 years old. Facts: Former 8-term House member; Former Vermont state senator for 14 years; Oldest freshman senator when elected at age 75.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Virginia?
column2: Mark Warner (D), 70 years old. Facts: Former Virginia Governor; Made fortune in cellular telephone industry; Former chair of Senate Intelligence Committee.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Virginia?
column2: Tim Kaine (D), 67 years old. Facts: Former Virginia Governor and Hillary Clinton's 2016 VP nominee; Former mayor of Richmond; Speaks fluent Spanish (did missionary work in Honduras).

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Washington?
column2: Patty Murray (D), 74 years old. Facts: Longest-serving female senator currently; Former preschool teacher called 'mom in tennis shoes'; Senate President Pro Tempore (3rd in line).

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Washington?
column2: Maria Cantwell (D), 66 years old. Facts: Former House member and tech executive; Strong on tech and energy policy; Chairs Senate Commerce Committee.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from West Virginia?
column2: Joe Manchin (I), 78 years old. Facts: Former West Virginia Governor; Most conservative Democrat (now Independent) who often bucked party; Killed Build Back Better in 2021-2022.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from West Virginia?
column2: Jim Justice (R), 73 years old. Facts: Former West Virginia Governor (was Democrat then switched); Coal billionaire and one of wealthiest senators; Owns Greenbrier Resort.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Wisconsin?
column2: Tammy Baldwin (D), 63 years old. Facts: First openly gay person elected to Senate; Former 7-term House member; Only openly LGBTQ senator when first elected.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Wisconsin?
column2: Ron Johnson (R), 70 years old. Facts: Businessman who made fortune in plastics manufacturing; Tea Party conservative elected in 2010; Known for contrarian positions on COVID and other issues.

column1: Who is the Senior Senator from Wyoming?
column2: John Barrasso (R), 73 years old. Facts: Orthopedic surgeon who practiced for 24 years; Senate Republican Conference Chair (3rd in leadership); Appointed initially then elected.

column1: Who is the Junior Senator from Wyoming?
column2: Cynthia Lummis (R), 70 years old. Facts: Former House member and Wyoming state treasurer; First woman to represent Wyoming in Senate; Rancher and strong advocate for cryptocurrency.
